alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 9:38AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...High Water On Most Rivers This Week... Heavy snowmelt in the Brooks Range is causing water levels to rise on many rivers draining the south side of the Brooks Range. Larger rivers such as the the Colleen, the Sheenjek, the Chandalar and the Koyukuk, and their tributaries, all have high water. There is a risk of minor flooding this week along all of these rivers due to the high water from snowmelt. There is also a risk that ice jams could form and cause localized ice jam flooding on these rivers this week. People along rivers should prepare for the possibility of high water levels this week due to ice breakup and snowmelt runoff. River access points and gravel bars will likely be covered with water along with increased debris in rivers. The latest breakup information is available at www.weather.gov/aprfc/breakupMap.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley
